contentrichtext.text: {{Orphan|date=February 2009}} '''Zakharoff Ridge''' ({{Coord|72|55|S|75|7|E||display=inline,title}}) is a ridge with several peaks, mostly snow covered, 1.5 miles (2.4 km) southeast of [[Mount Harding]] in the [[Grove Mountains]]. Mapped by ANARE ([[Australian National Antarctic Research Expeditions]]) from air photos, 1956â€“60, it was named by [[Antarctic Names Committee of Australia]] (ANCA) for [[Oleg Zakharoff]], radio officer at [[Mawson Station]], in 1960. {{usgs-gazetteer}} [[Category:Ridges of Antarctica]] [[Category:Landforms of Princess Elizabeth Land]] {{PrincessElizabethLand-geo-stub}}
